snippet: A report that cited “collective incompetence” of the country’s security forces was leaked after Pakistani authorities had suppressed it for months.
abstract: Pakistani government report investigating American raid in May 2011 that killed Osama bin Laden is leaked to Al Jazeera after authorities had suppressed it for months; scathing report, which cites collective incompetence of the country’s security forces, offers most comprehensive official account yet of Bin Laden's time on the run in Pakistan and the American Navy SEALS raid that took his life.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: A report that cited “collective incompetence” of the country’s security forces was leaked after Pakistani authorities had suppressed it for months.

headline.main: Leaked Report Cites Pakistan’s Failings Before U.S. Killed Bin Laden
headline.print_headline: Leaked Report Cites Pakistan’s Failings Before U.S. Killed Bin Laden
